ygData.subject: Re: Camping, a solution
ygData.msgSnippet: If you are more concerned with gaining adventures rather than gaining items , then your arguement makes sense.  You don t want to dedicate any time to
ygData.messageBody:
If you are more concerned with "gaining adventures" rather than "gaining items", then your arguement makes sense. You don't want to dedicate any time to obtaining a particular magic item, you just want to blindly stumble into some item and not put any real time or work or time into getting particular items. Which I can kinda see the satisfaction of randomly finding a cool item....but at the same time there is a great sense of accomplishment after working hours and hours of getting your butt stomped then scoring the item that you really really want.

>>> "Obergfell, Steven" <SObergfell@...> 5.25.99 5:59:34 PM >>>
From: "Obergfell, Steven" <SObergfell@...>
What randomizing loot will do is make it unproductive to try and go and get
such and such item. The game becomes less of a pursuit of gaining items,
and more of a pursuit of gaining adventures.


-----Original Message-----
From: Jason Coan [mailto:COANJ@...]
Sent: Tuesday, May 25, 1999 3:38 PM
To: warriors_eq@onelist.com
Subject: Re: [warriors_eq] Camping, a solution


From: "Jason Coan" <COANJ@...>

You do of course realize that there would be no way to hunt for the
particular item you are looking for, right? ie, a 35th lvl item, one that a
35th lvl monster drops, ie rubicite bracers. So lets concider where all you
would have to go to look for this item

Karanas- could be any of the griffins or giants
oasis-could be one of the spectres or giants
s ro-could be on one of the giants
e commons-could be on a griffin
w commons-could be on a giant or griffin
cazic thule-could be on any number of monsters there
mistmoore-could be on any number of monsters there
soulsekB-could be on any number of monsters there
befallen-it could conceivably spawn on commander windstream

so would it make since to go to all these places to look for a particular
item, or would you just find a pretty safe place to camp and wait to see
what item spawned on one of the creatures that you are camping? I would
think your odds of finding "random" items like this would be equal if you
camped one spot, or if you traveled to various zones. Doesn't seem like
this would promote adventuring. And it would take FOREVER to actually get
an item you want.

>>> "Jynxx" <Jynxx@...> 5.25.99 3:11:43 PM >>>
From: "Jynxx" <Jynxx@...>

YES!!!!!!!!!!!!!
That's what we need! A random item spawn.....I'll even take it one step
further:
Lets say that said sword is on a level 45 person...so we'll call that a
'level 45 item' it can then spawn to any level 45+ NPC in all of the zone,
or even norrath. That would make people have to travel A LOT to find items
they want, and would completely prevent camping for items altogether. That
way if you really wanted an item bad enough, your group had to go search for
it...not just sit sround and wait for it....that to me is not even
role-playing.
Just my 2 cents.

Tyveris
